title: The Launch: Fashion News to Know This July
excerpt: Plus, more fashion news to know this month.
text: High summer is in full swing—and with it, the season’s hottest fashion launches just keep coming. July kicks off with Net-a-Porter’s curated shopping experience in the Hamptons, Melissa and Diesel’s exclusive new jelly sandals, Jacques Marie Mage’s first Paris flagship, and more. From headline-making fashion news to can’t-miss releases, here’s everything you need to know this month.Net-a-Porter and Mr Porter Host a Pop-Up in the HamptonsTyler JoeWho: Net-a-Porter and Mr PorterWhat: “Summer in the Hamptons” pop-upWhere: WYETH in Sagaponack, New York through July 20Why: For the first time ever, Net-a-Porter and Mr Porter are staging a pop-up in the Hamptons. WYETH in Sagaponack—a mid-century furniture showroom and Hamptons staple—will host a curated selection of luxury womenswear, including designers such as Chloé, Johanna Ortiz, Tom Ford, Khaite, Alaïa, and more. In addition to the fashion edit, expert in-house styling advice and exclusive brand activations—like express treatments from Dr. Barbara Sturm—will also be available.Khaite Sicily Printed Satin-Twill Midi DressJohanna Ortiz Pwani Cropped Crochet HalterneckAlaïa Le Teckel Leather Trimmed Canvas ClutchFleur du Mal Opens a Must-Visit Boutique in WilliamsburgCourtesy of Fleur du MalWho: Fleur du MalWhat: New boutiqueWhere: Williamsburg, BrooklynWhy: Like many others, Fleur du Mal is putting down roots in Brooklyn’s Williamsburg neighborhood, marking the beloved lingerie brand’s third retail location to date. Following the success of its Soho boutique, which opened in 2017, and the Los Angeles flagship that arrived in 2021, this latest outpost offers yet another destination for female-forward indulgence, empowerment, and sophistication. Fleur du Mal Le Stretch Micro Seduce U-Plunge BraFleur du Mal Riviera Stripe PJ TopFleur du Mal Lily Embroidery Hipster ThongMelissa and Diesel Team Up for an Exclusive Jelly Sandal CollaborationCourtesy of DieselWho: Melissa and Diesel What: Exclusive collaborationWhere: Online at shopmelissa.com and diesel.comWhy: Jelly sandals are so back. Case in point: Melissa and Diesel have teamed up to launch this summer’s most subversive footwear. Combining the former’s signature jelly technology with the latter’s bold, edgy design sensibility, the collection introduces three standout styles: the Quantum Thong, Quantum Platform, and Quantum Sneaker. Melissa x Diesel Quantum ThongMelissa x Diesel Quantum PlatformMelissa x Diesel Quantum SneakerJacques Marie Mage Opens Its First French FlagshipCourtesy of Jacques Marie MageWho: Jacques Marie MageWhat: Flagship boutique Where: ParisWhy: Los Angeles-based eyewear designer Jacques Marie Mage has opened its first Parisian flagship boutique. Located in the historic second arrondissement, the two-story space brings a modern perspective to traditional French design, drawing inspiration from the grandeur of Napoleonic style. The flagship is the brand’s largest European gallery to date, offering limited-edition eyewear, leather goods, and jewelry displayed among objets d’art. On offer are pieces from the spring/summer 2025 collection, the Coco Beach line, and more—including the ever-coveted Chanel 25 handbag. To fête the opening, the house hosted an intimate dinner at Swifty’s, the beloved Palm Beach import now on-site, capped off with a live performance by singer-songwriter Ashe.Chanel Baume EssentielChanel Square SunglassesChanel Hydra Beauty Essence MistFashion Trust Arabia Announces 2025 Advisory BoardCourtesy of Fashion Trust ArabiaWho: Fashion Trust ArabiaWhat: Fashion Trust Arabia AwardsWhere: Doha, QatarWhy: The Fashion Trust Arabia Awards will return for the seventh time this November, spotlighting emerging talent from across the globe. An advisory board of industry leaders—including ELLE editor-in-chief Nina Garcia—will select 21 finalists across seven categories: eveningwear, ready-to-wear, accessories, jewelry, new talent, honorary awards, and a guest country: India, in partnership with the Nita Mukesh Ambani Cultural Centre.Erdem Floral-Print Midi DressNow 60% OffSimone Rocha Turbo Embellished Denim JacketNow 50% OffMary Katrantzou Iris Pleated Floral-Print Midi DressGiorgio Armani and Kith Return for a Second CollaborationCourtesy of Giorgio ArmaniWho: Giorgio Armani and KithWhat: Exclusive capsule collectionWhere: Online and in-store at kith.com and at select Giorgio Armani locations, including its Hamptons boutiqueWhy: Armani and Kith are back for their second collaboration—now with the addition of womenswear. The capsule pays direct tribute to the easy silhouettes and chic casual wear that permeate the Armani archives. Pieces range from graphic T-shirts to silk dresses and printed kimono cover-ups. Inspired by the bold dynamism of ’90s tennis, Brooks Brothers and Prince have teamed up for an exclusive co-branded capsule collection that bridges modern design with nostalgic aesthetics. The limited-edition collab includes graphic T-shirts, polos, track sets, and more.Brooks Brothers Embroidered Henry Baseball CapBrooks Brothers Tennis Sweater VestBrooks Brothers Performance CoolMax Socks
html:
High summer is in full swing—and with it, the season’s hottest fashion launches just keep coming. July kicks off with Net-a-Porter’s curated shopping experience in the Hamptons, Melissa and Diesel’s exclusive new jelly sandals, Jacques Marie Mage’s first Paris flagship, and more. From headline-making fashion news to can’t-miss releases, here’s everything you need to know this month.

Net-a-Porter and Mr Porter Host a Pop-Up in the Hamptons

Who: Net-a-Porter and Mr Porter

What: “Summer in the Hamptons” pop-up

Where: WYETH in Sagaponack, New York through July 20

Why: For the first time ever, Net-a-Porter and Mr Porter are staging a pop-up in the Hamptons. WYETH in Sagaponack—a mid-century furniture showroom and Hamptons staple—will host a curated selection of luxury womenswear, including designers such as Chloé, Johanna Ortiz, Tom Ford, Khaite, Alaïa, and more. In addition to the fashion edit, expert in-house styling advice and exclusive brand activations—like express treatments from Dr. Barbara Sturm—will also be available.

Khaite Sicily Printed Satin-Twill Midi Dress

Johanna Ortiz Pwani Cropped Crochet Halterneck

Alaïa Le Teckel Leather Trimmed Canvas Clutch

Fleur du Mal Opens a Must-Visit Boutique in Williamsburg

Who: Fleur du Mal

What: New boutique

Where: Williamsburg, Brooklyn

Why: Like many others, Fleur du Mal is putting down roots in Brooklyn’s Williamsburg neighborhood, marking the beloved lingerie brand’s third retail location to date. Following the success of its Soho boutique, which opened in 2017, and the Los Angeles flagship that arrived in 2021, this latest outpost offers yet another destination for female-forward indulgence, empowerment, and sophistication.

Fleur du Mal Le Stretch Micro Seduce U-Plunge Bra

Fleur du Mal Riviera Stripe PJ Top

Fleur du Mal Lily Embroidery Hipster Thong

Melissa and Diesel Team Up for an Exclusive Jelly Sandal Collaboration

Who: Melissa and Diesel

What: Exclusive collaboration

Where: Online at shopmelissa.com and diesel.com

Why: Jelly sandals are so back. Case in point: Melissa and Diesel have teamed up to launch this summer’s most subversive footwear. Combining the former’s signature jelly technology with the latter’s bold, edgy design sensibility, the collection introduces three standout styles: the Quantum Thong, Quantum Platform, and Quantum Sneaker.

Melissa x Diesel Quantum Thong

Melissa x Diesel Quantum Platform

Melissa x Diesel Quantum Sneaker

Jacques Marie Mage Opens Its First French Flagship

Who: Jacques Marie Mage

What: Flagship boutique

Where: Paris

Why: Los Angeles-based eyewear designer Jacques Marie Mage has opened its first Parisian flagship boutique. Located in the historic second arrondissement, the two-story space brings a modern perspective to traditional French design, drawing inspiration from the grandeur of Napoleonic style. The flagship is the brand’s largest European gallery to date, offering limited-edition eyewear, leather goods, and jewelry displayed among objets d’art.

Jacques Marie Mage Mattei D-Frame Acetate Sunglasses

Jacques Marie Mage Lockheed Aviator-Style Titanium Sunglasses

Jacques Marie Mage Barclay Aviator-Style Acetate Sunglasses

Chanel Unveils a Private Summer Salon in the Hamptons

Who: Chanel

What: Hamptons Summer Salon

Where: 74 James Lane, East Hampton, New York through July 28

Why: Chanel is kicking up its heels and heading east with the rest of the fashion crowd, opening a Hamptons Summer Salon at The Hedges Inn—a newly renovated B&B in East Hampton. On offer are pieces from the spring/summer 2025 collection, the Coco Beach line, and more—including the ever-coveted Chanel 25 handbag. To fête the opening, the house hosted an intimate dinner at Swifty’s, the beloved Palm Beach import now on-site, capped off with a live performance by singer-songwriter Ashe.

Chanel Baume Essentiel

Chanel Square Sunglasses

Chanel Hydra Beauty Essence Mist

Fashion Trust Arabia Announces 2025 Advisory Board

Who: Fashion Trust Arabia

What: Fashion Trust Arabia Awards

Where: Doha, Qatar

Why: The Fashion Trust Arabia Awards will return for the seventh time this November, spotlighting emerging talent from across the globe. An advisory board of industry leaders—including ELLE editor-in-chief Nina Garcia—will select 21 finalists across seven categories: eveningwear, ready-to-wear, accessories, jewelry, new talent, honorary awards, and a guest country: India, in partnership with the Nita Mukesh Ambani Cultural Centre.

Erdem Floral-Print Midi Dress

Now 60% Off

Simone Rocha Turbo Embellished Denim Jacket

Now 50% Off

Mary Katrantzou Iris Pleated Floral-Print Midi Dress

Giorgio Armani and Kith Return for a Second Collaboration

Who: Giorgio Armani and Kith

What: Exclusive capsule collection

Where: Online and in-store at kith.com and at select Giorgio Armani locations, including its Hamptons boutique

Why: Armani and Kith are back for their second collaboration—now with the addition of womenswear. The capsule pays direct tribute to the easy silhouettes and chic casual wear that permeate the Armani archives. Pieces range from graphic T-shirts to silk dresses and printed kimono cover-ups.

Giorgio Armani x Kith SS97 Silk Dress

Giorgio Armani x Kith Women’s Bikini

Giorgio Armani x Kith Scenic Printed Bandana

Brooks Brothers Releases a Tennis Capsule With Prince

Who: Brooks Brothers

What: Collaboration with Prince

Where: Online at brooksbrothers.com

Why: This summer, enhance your style on and off the courts. Inspired by the bold dynamism of ’90s tennis, Brooks Brothers and Prince have teamed up for an exclusive co-branded capsule collection that bridges modern design with nostalgic aesthetics. The limited-edition collab includes graphic T-shirts, polos, track sets, and more.

Brooks Brothers Embroidered Henry Baseball Cap

Brooks Brothers Tennis Sweater Vest

Brooks Brothers Performance CoolMax Socks
